citation.article-title: Acetonema longum gen. nov. sp. nov., an H2/CO2 acetogenic bacterium from the termite, Pterotermes occidentis.

p.s: Description of Acetonema longum sp. nov.
Acetonema longum (lon'gum. L. neut. adj. longum long in shape)
Thin, straight rods with rounded ends, 0.3- 0.4 x 6- 60 μm.
Cells single or in chains of 3-4 cells.
Translational motility unmistakably observed only for cells placed on agar-covered slides, not in conventional wet mounts.
Several peritrichous flagella present.
Mature endospores are 1 μm in diameter, spherical, terminal in location, and markedly swell the sporangium.
Subsurface colonies of H2/CO2-grown cells in 2% agar are 1 - 2 mm in diameter, circular with uneven edges, and opaque with a slight brown color.
Colonies on 1.5% agar streak plates are entirely subsurface, spreading, semi-transparent, and off white in color, and can attain a diameter up to 1 cm.
Strict anaerobe.
Catalase positive, oxidase negative.
Obtains energy for growth by acetogenesis from H2 + CO2 according to the stoichiometry: 4 H2 + 2CO2 → CH3COOH + 2H2O.

Other energy-yielding substrates include glucose, fructose, mannose, ribose, rhamnose, mannitol, pyruvate and oxaloacetate which are fermented to butyrate and acetate as principle volatile fatty acids.
Significant amounts of H2, CO2 and propionate are also formed from glucose; and H2, CO2, succinate and 1,2-propanediol are also formed from rhamnose.
Acetate was the sole volatile fatty acid formed during fermentation of ethylene glycol and 3,4,5- trimethoxybenzoate.
pH optimum, 7.8 (range 6.4-8.6); temperature optimum, 30- 33°C (range 19-40°C).
Trypticase or yeast extract required for good growth.
DNA base composition: 51.5 mol% G + C (strain APO-1; buoyant density).
Source: Gut contents of the termite Pterotermes occidentis (Walker) (Kalotermitidae).
Type strain: Strain APO-1, DSM 6540, deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig.
